snippet: As French citizens mourned their dead, the authorities were carrying out an intense search for the brothers suspected of attacking a Paris newspaper.
abstract: Thousands of French law enforcement agents start exhaustive manhunt for Said and Cherif Kouachi, suspects in of Charlie Hebdo massacre in Paris; third suspect Hamyd Mourad turns himself into police; search is focused in northern France, where suspects allegedly stole food from a gas station.

byline.original: By STEVEN ERLANGER and DAN BILEFSKY
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Maïa de la Baume from Paris; David Jolly from Longpont, France; Ravi Somaiya from New York; and Elena Schneider from Washington.

lead_paragraph: As French citizens mourned their dead, the authorities were carrying out an intense search for the brothers suspected of attacking a Paris newspaper.

headline.main: Police Hunt for Suspects in Paris Attack as Nation Mourns
headline.print_headline: As France Mourns, Police Hunt for Suspects in Newspaper Attack
